alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Camden and southeastern Currituck Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grandy, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grandy, Sanderling, Old Trap, Jarvisburg, Powells Point, Poplar Branch, Aydlett, Texas, Bertha and Goose Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
